Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: pkg-config

Arguments.Name: --mod-version
Arguments.Description: Display the version information of the libraries specified on the command line

Arguments.Name: --version
Arguments.Description: Display the version of pkg-config and terminates

Arguments.Name: --atleast-pkgconfig-version
Arguments.Description: Require at least the given version of pkg-config

Arguments.Name: version
Arguments.Description: version

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Displays a help message and terminates

Arguments.Name: --print-errors
Arguments.Description: Print errors if modules cannot be found or if an error occurs in parsing a .pc file

Arguments.Name: --short-errors
Arguments.Description: Print short error messages

Arguments.Name: --silence-errors
Arguments.Description: Print errors if modules cannot be found or if an error occurs in parsing a .pc file

Arguments.Name: --errors-to-stdout
Arguments.Description: If printing errors, print them to stdout rather than the default stderr

Arguments.Name: --debug
Arguments.Description: Print debugging information

Arguments.Name: --cflags
Arguments.Description: Print pre-processor and compile flags required to compile the packages on the command line

Arguments.Name: --cflags-only-I
Arguments.Description: Print parts of "--cflags" that define the header search path

Arguments.Name: --cflags-only-other
Arguments.Description: Print parts of "--cflags" not covered by "--cflags-only-I"

Arguments.Name: --libs
Arguments.Description: Print link flags required to compile the packages on the command line

Arguments.Name: --libs-only-L
Arguments.Description: Print parts of "-libs" that define library search path

Arguments.Name: --libs-only-l
Arguments.Description: Print parts of "-libs" that specify which libraries to link to

Arguments.Name: --libs-only-other
Arguments.Description: Print parts of "-libs" not covered by "--libs-only-L" and "--libs-only-l"

Arguments.Name: --variable
Arguments.Description: Return the value of a variable defined in a package's .pc file

Arguments.Name: variable-name
Arguments.Description: variable-name

Arguments.Name: --define-variable
Arguments.Description: Set a global value for a variable, overriding the value in any .pc files

Arguments.Name: variable
Arguments.Description: variable

Arguments.Name: --print-variables
Arguments.Description: Return a list of all variables defined in the package

Arguments.Name: --uninstalled
Arguments.Description: Return successfully if any "-uninstalled" packages are being used, and return failure otherwise

Arguments.Name: --exists
Arguments.Description: Test whether the packages on the command line exist

Arguments.Name: --atleast-version
Arguments.Description: Test whether the packages on the command line exist and are at least the specified version

Arguments.Name: version
Arguments.Description: version

Arguments.Name: --exact-version
Arguments.Description: Test whether the packages on the command line exist and are exactly the specified version

Arguments.Name: version
Arguments.Description: version

Arguments.Name: --max-version
Arguments.Description: Test whether the packages on the command line exist and are at most the specified version

Arguments.Name: version
Arguments.Description: version

Arguments.Name: --validate
Arguments.Description: Check the syntax of a package's .pc file for validity

Arguments.Name: --msvc-syntax
Arguments.Description: Output -l and -L flags in the form recognized by the Microsoft Visual C++ command-line compiler

Arguments.Name: --define-prefix
Arguments.Description: Use the installed location of the .pc file to determine the prefix

Arguments.Name: --dont-define-prefix
Arguments.Description: Use the specified prefix variable value defined in the .pc file as the prefix

Arguments.Name: --prefix-variable
Arguments.Description: Set the name of the variable to be overridden instead of prefix when using --define-prefix

Arguments.Name: variable-name
Arguments.Description: variable-name

Arguments.Name: --static
Arguments.Description: Output libraries suitable for static linking

Arguments.Name: --list-all
Arguments.Description: List all modules found in the pkg-config path

Arguments.Name: --print-provides
Arguments.Description: List all modules the given packages provides

Arguments.Name: --print-requires
Arguments.Description: List all modules the given packages requires

Arguments.Name: --print-requires-private
Arguments.Description: List all modules the given packages requires for static linking

Arguments.Name: libraries...
Arguments.Description: libraries...
